mortality.note: Poland lost ~30% of its population. Some estimates higher when including famine and plague. Cities like Warsaw reduced to rubble.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Organized military campaign, systematic looting of cities, churches, libraries. Cultural treasures shipped to Sweden.
rationales.profit: Primary motive was plunder. Swedish Empire financed through conquest. Stripped Poland of wealth, art, archives.
rationales.ideology: Some Protestant vs Catholic dimension, but primarily territorial and economic.
rationales.complicity: Swedish soldiers, allied forces, some Polish nobles collaborated. Europe largely watched.

analysis.pattern_note: Often forgotten outside Poland. One of the most destructive events in Polish history. Swedish army systematically looted cultural heritage - archives, art, libraries shipped to Stockholm. Demonstrates that European powers inflicted colonial-style extraction on each other, not just overseas.
analysis.root_causes: Swedish imperial expansion, Polish-Lithuanian weakness, religious tensions, opportunity for plunder
